overview: Due to the impact of COVID-19, this subject is being undertaken by the Doctor of Medicine Year 3 cohorts in 2020, 2021, and 2022, in lieu of MEDS90020 Principles of Clinical Practice 3.

The aim of Principles of Clinical Practice 3A is to build on the foundation provided by the Principles of Clinical Practice 2 to further develop key clinical learning across all age groups, and in diverse and complex patient groups. The subject will include core knowledge and clinical learning in women’s health, children and adolescent health, mental health, general practice and aged care. First Nations Health and Professional Practice teaching and learning are integrated across the year.
intended learning outcomes: Theme: Clinician Scientist (Knowledge) Apply biomedical sciences knowledge including determinants of health to explain the underlying mechanisms of patient presentation and recommendations for initial management across the age spectrum

Theme: Clinician Scientist (Skills) Incorporate essential biomedical sciences knowledge in proposing a scientifically supported differential diagnosis with rationale for the principal diagnosis, and an initial management plan across the age spectrum

Theme: Clinician Researcher (Knowledge) Apply the key principles of generating new knowledge and for practising evidence-based medicine, including research question formulation, study design, literature searching, and the translation of research findings to specialty patient presentations

Theme: Clinician Researcher(Skills) Analyse and apply a variety of resources to determine the effectiveness, efficiency and appropriateness of current health care practices in speciality health disciplines

assessments.description: Work-based learning (WBL) activities. 4 hours. Hurdle requirement:. Satisfactory standard in all term related work based activities

Mini-Clinical Evaluation Exercise (mini-CEX)
-Minimum of 3 standard Mini-CEX per term (15 in total), including a mixture of peer and tutor/clinician assessments - with a minimum of 2 per term (10 in total) assessed by clinicians.. 6 hours. Hurdle requirement:. Yes, Satisfactory standard in all clinician assessed term related (mini-CEX)

Portfolio
A student curated compilation that responds to prescribed tasks submitted regularly throughout the year, addressing five key themes: 
- First Nations 
- Clinician researcher 
- Professional practitioner 
- Self-regulated learner
 - Determinants of health and health systems. 7000 words. Hurdle requirement:. Satisfactory standard in each of the five Portfolio themes
Progress Test. 3 hours. Hurdle requirement:. Participation in the Progress Test
Written examination (MCQ/EMQ). 2 hours. Hurdle requirement:. Satisfactory standard
Written exam (SAQ). 2 hours. Hurdle requirement:. Satisfactory standard
Standardised Case Based Discussion (SCBD) X2. 60 minutes (each). Hurdle requirement:. Satisfactory standard in combined SCBD end of semester 1 and SCBD end of year scores, equally weighted
assessments.timing: End of the first semester & during the examination period

assessments.description: Objective structured clinical examinations  (OSCE). 4.5 hours. Hurdle requirement:. Satisfactory standard
Professional Behaviour. Hurdle requirement:. Satisfactory standard in professional behaviour including satisfactory completion of the Academic Integrity quiz
Attendance - tutorials. Hurdle requirement:. 75% attendance at lectures, tutorials and practical classes
Attendance - clinical. Hurdle requirement:. 100% attendance at clinical placements and field visits

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
